ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Was follow-up phone call conducted
Date follow-up phone call conducted
Notes: 1=One day after Day 1; 2=One day after Day 14; 3=One week after Day 14; 4=One month after Day 14; 5 = One day after Day 10; 6 = One week after Day 10; 7 = One month after Day 10; 8 = Day 2; 9 = Day 6; 10 = Day 7; 11 = Day 8; 12 = Day 9; 13 = One day after drug screening; 14 = Day 3; 15 = Day 4; -9=Unknown

ElementDescription: Returned for medical screening
Phone call: comments
Was SCID completed?
When was the SCID completed?
Is there any present or past psychiatric condition including substance abuse or dependence, with the exception of nicotine dependence?
Meets DSM-5 diagnostic criteria for psychotic disorder, including SCZ/schizoaffective disorder (SAD) or psychotic disorder not elsewhere classified (PDNEC)
Visit name
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Staff code number of person completing this form
How is (subject - child of respondent) doing?
Have you noticed tics in your child in the past 3 months?
Have you noticed tics in your child in the past week?
Since we last saw you, have you sought treatment or medical advice for (subject - child of respondent)?
Are you considering seeking treatment or medical advice for (subject - child of respondent)?
